title: SEC529: Quantum Security Readiness for Executives
description: A one-day executive course that helps security leaders assess quantum risk, understand regulatory timelines, and build a practical roadmap to become quantum-safe before 2030.

title: LDR514: Security Strategic Planning, Policy, and Leadership
description: This course offers an MBA-level approach, preparing cybersecurity leaders to build strategic plans, craft effective policies, and lead across technical and business teams.

title: FOR508: Advanced Incident Response, Threat Hunting, and Digital Forensics
description: Learn the advanced incident response and threat hunting skills you need to identify, counter, and recover from a wide range of threats within enterprise networks.

title: SEC401: Security Essentials - Network, Endpoint, and Cloud
description: Gain essential cybersecurity skills to quickly detect, respond to, and remediate threats. Learn how to protect critical information and technology assets, whether on-premises or in the cloud.

title: SEC560: Enterprise Penetration Testing
description: Learn enterprise-scale penetration testing; identify, exploit, and assess real business risks across on-prem, Azure, and Entra ID environments through hands-on labs and an intensive CTF.

title: LDR512: Security Leadership Essentials for Managers
description: Gain essential technical and leadership skills to effectively manage security programs, covering key topics like security architecture, vulnerability management, cloud security, and GenAI security.

title: FOR578: Cyber Threat Intelligence
description: Master tactical, operational, and strategic cyber threat intelligence skills. Improve analytic processes and incident response effectiveness to support your detection and response programs.

title: ICS410: ICS/SCADA Security Essentials
description: Reinforce critical cybersecurity skills to secure industrial control systems and operational technology against emerging threats while maintaining operational resilience in industrial environments.

title: SEC530: Defensible Security Architecture and Engineering: Implementing Zero Trust for the Hybrid Enterprise
description: Achieve a holistic approach to defensible security architecture and engineering. Master tactics from network segmentation to conditional access and privileged identity controls under Zero Trust.

title: ICS310: ICS Cybersecurity Foundations
description: ICS310: ICS Cybersecurity Foundations builds foundational knowledge of ICS systems and explores how automation works across industries. Students analyze real-world cyberattacks to uncover defense strategies and learn five key ICS controls adaptable to any environment.

title: SEC497: Practical Open-Source Intelligence (OSINT)
description: Learn to perform effective, secure OSINT research with practical techniques. Explore critical OSINT tools and apply your skills in hands-on labs based on real-world scenarios.

title: AIS247: AI Security Essentials for Business Leaders
description: This course equips executives, business leaders, and key staff with the essential knowledge to understand, oversee, and govern AI adoption responsibly and securely. With practical insight into generative AI, AI literacy, technology trends, risk management frameworks, policy governance, and real-world security threats, AIS247 ensures leaders are prepared to make informed decisions that align innovation with security and compliance.

title: ICS515: ICS Visibility, Detection, and Response
description: Acquire critical visibility, detection, and response capabilities to protect ICS/OT environments against sophisticated threats while ensuring the safety and reliability of operations.

title: FOR572: Advanced Network Forensics: Threat Hunting, Analysis, and Incident Response
description: Deepen your advanced network forensics experience, including threat hunting, analysis, and incident response. Explore the tools, technology, and processes needed to integrate network evidence sources.

title: FOR610: Reverse-Engineering Malware: Malware Analysis Tools and Techniques
description: Explore malware analysis tools and techniques in depth and acquire the practical skills to examine malicious programs that target and infect Windows systems.

title: SEC502: Cloud Security Tactical Defense
description: Gain tactical skills to configure, monitor, and defend cloud environments while addressing data security and compliance challenges.

title: SEC540: Cloud Native Security and DevSecOps Automation
description: Gain the skills and methodology to secure modern Cloud Native, DevSecOps, and Kubernetes environments through hands-on labs using security controls in CI/CD pipelines for cloud systems.

title: SEC511: Cybersecurity Engineering: Advanced Threat Detection and Monitoring
description: Learn cutting-edge cybersecurity engineering and advanced threat detection skills for cloud, network, and endpoint environments in this comprehensive course.

title: FOR509: Enterprise Cloud Forensics and Incident Response
description: Cloud forensics is evolving. FOR509 equips examiners to embrace new evidence sources in enterprise cloud environments instead of forcing outdated on-premise methods.

title: SEC549: Cloud Security Architecture
description: Learn to design enterprise-ready, scalable cloud solutions for your organization. Engage in threat modeling and secure architecture review labs to experience the cloud migration journey.

title: LDR553: Cyber Incident Management
description: Develop essential leadership skills to effectively manage cyber incidents from discovery to resolution, providing clear direction when your organization needs it most.

title: SEC573: AI-Powered Security Automation: Building Tools with Python, LLMs, and MCP
description: Learn how we can leverage Agentic AI development and Python as security professionals. From the Python essentials to developing AI Agents for your own information security tools.

title: SEC565: Red Team Operations and Adversary Emulation
description: Master Red Team operations by leveraging adversary emulation, cyber threat intelligence, and Red Team tradecraft to execute consistent, repeatable engagements that improve defense effectiveness.

title: SEC660: Advanced Penetration Testing, Exploit Writing, and Ethical Hacking
description: Learn advanced penetration testing skills to develop custom exploits, perform network attacks, analyze cryptographic implementations, and master advanced exploitation techniques.

title: LDR414: SANS Training Program for CISSP® Certification
description: Accelerate your CISSP® certification journey with an intensive review course designed by leading cybersecurity practitioners to prepare you for the current 2024 version of the exam.

title: LDR551: Building and Leading Security Operations Centers
description: Stop reactive firefighting. Learn to build SOC operations from the ground up—with the right people, threat-focused detection, battle-tested incident response, and metrics that drive real results.

title: SEC588: Cloud Penetration Testing
description: Cloud security starts with thinking like the adversary—hack, test, and assess cloud environments built from real-world attacks.

title: SEC599: Defeating Advanced Adversaries - Purple Team Tactics & Kill Chain Defenses
description: Learn advanced defensive techniques through hands-on labs and real-world scenarios to effectively prevent, detect, and respond to sophisticated cyber-attacks through a purple team strategy.

title: SEC541: Cloud Security Threat Detection
description: Acquire elite cloud threat detection capabilities to identify, analyze, and respond to sophisticated attacks in AWS and Azure environments.

title: FOR577: LINUX Incident Response and Threat Hunting
description: Learn the skills you need to identify, analyze, and respond to attacks on Linux platforms and how to use threat hunting techniques to find stealthy attackers who can bypass existing controls.

title: LDR519: Cybersecurity Risk Management and Compliance
description: Master strategic cybersecurity risk management through practical frameworks, comprehensive threat modeling, and regulatory compliance-driven governance to strengthen enterprise resilience.

title: SEC402: Cybersecurity Writing: Hack the Reader
description: Security professionals possess technical prowess but often struggle to effectively communicate critical findings. This course equips cybersecurity practitioners with sophisticated communication strategies for penetrating reader indifference. Through targeted exercises built on real-world scenarios, participants dissect problematic security communications and rebuild them using five essential elements of effective writing. The curriculum focuses on practical implementation rather than theoretical grammar rules, enabling participants to immediately elevate their incident reports, threat assessments, and security advisories. By strengthening writing capabilities, security professionals can ensure their technical insights achieve the operational impact they deserve within their organizations.

title: SEC522: Application Security: Securing Web Applications, APIs, and Microservices
description: Gain the skills you need to understand and mitigate vulnerabilities and secure web applications, APIs, and microservices.

title: SEC403: Secrets to Successful Cybersecurity Presentation
description: In the cybersecurity realm, technical prowess alone rarely drives change. SEC403 equips professionals with the precise communication tactics needed to transform technical findings into actionable intelligence that resonates with diverse audiences. This intensive course addresses the critical gap between security expertise and influence, teaching participants to craft messages that capture attention, maintain engagement, and persuade key stakeholders to act.

title: FOR518: Mac and iOS Forensic Analysis and Incident Response
description: Conduct detailed, in-depth analysis on raw data from Mac and iOS cases. Gain confidence in your forensic analysis and incident response skills with hands-on labs.

title: SEC501: Advanced Security Essentials - Enterprise Defender
description: Gain hands-on, cross-disciplinary cyber defense skills and prepare for CERT/CSIRT roles with 25+ labs using real cyber tools for network security, malware analysis, SecOps, forensics, and more.

title: FOR589: Cybercrime Investigations
description: Learn how to investigate cybercrime from end to end—uncover attacker tactics, trace financial activity, and analyze digital evidence to support attribution and incident response.

title: SEC555: Detection Engineering and SIEM Analytics
description: Gain hands-on skills in Detection Engineering and SIEM, learning the processes for understanding logs, enhancing existing logging solutions, and creating detection content that fits your needs.

title: SEC617: Wireless Penetration Testing and Ethical Hacking
description: Learn to evaluate, assess, and exploit vulnerabilities across Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, RFID, and emerging wireless technologies, empowering practitioners to defend against sophisticated wireless attacks.

title: SEC575: iOS and Android Application Security Analysis and Penetration Testing
description: Learn to comprehensively assess and test the security of iOS and Android devices and applications through hands-on analysis and penetration testing techniques.

title: LDR516: Strategic Vulnerability and Threat Management
description: Integrate strategic and tactical approaches to level up enterprise vulnerability management programs while addressing infrastructure and cloud environment challenges.

title: SEC405: Business Finance Essentials
description: In today's complex business environment, cybersecurity leaders need more than technical expertise—they need financial acumen. SEC405: Business Finance Essentials™ equips you with the knowledge to confidently navigate your organization's financial landscape. Practical exercises teach you to create compelling business cases, design multi-year budgets, and communicate effectively with finance teams. This course bridges the gap between security and business priorities, helping you demonstrate value, secure resources, and advance your career.

title: LDR419: Performing A Cybersecurity Risk Assessment
description: Explore industry-leading strategies for conducting cybersecurity risk assessments that deliver actionable insights to protect your organization's critical assets and meet regulatory requirements.

title: SEC556: IoT Penetration Testing
description: SEC556 equips security professionals with comprehensive skills to identify, assess, and exploit IoT device security mechanisms across diverse technological ecosystems.

title: ICS612: ICS Cybersecurity In-Depth
description: Develop comprehensive defenses in industrial control systems, and master methodologies through hands-on exercises in a simulated operational technology environment with real-world components.

title: LDR521: Security Culture for Leaders
description: LDR521 turns decades of behavioral science into practical steps you can apply immediately, making security culture measurable, actionable, and sustainable through hands-on labs and tools.

title: FOR498: Digital Acquisition and Rapid Triage
description: Gain essential skills in digital forensic acquisition and rapid triage. Learn to collect and preserve data from diverse sources and then rapidly extract actionable intelligence.

title: SEC699: Advanced Purple Teaming - Adversary Emulation & Detection Engineering
description: Advanced purple team training empowers security professionals to simulate sophisticated threat actor techniques through comprehensive adversary emulation across complex enterprise environments.

title: SEC670: Red Teaming Tools - Developing Windows Implants, Shellcode, Command and Control
description: Sharpen elite professional security skills forging stealthy Windows implants, customized shellcode, and command and control frameworks that evade contemporary defenses.

title: SEC480: AWS Secure Builder
description: SEC480: AWS Secure Builder equips non-security personnel such as cloud engineers, developers, and architects with the security fundamentals necessary to build secure AWS workloads from the beginning. This course serves as foundational AWS security training, designed to fill the critical knowledge gap for technical professionals responsible for building and deploying workloads to AWS environments. Organizations operating in AWS face a level of complexity that can introduce vulnerabilities, frequently resulting from inadvertent misconfigurations.

title: SEC504J: Hacker Tools, Techniques, and Incident Handling (Japanese)
description: Transform your incident response skills; think like an attacker as you investigate cybersecurity incidents, develop threat intelligence, and apply defense strategies against real-world threats.

title: ICS456: Essentials for NERC Critical Infrastructure Protection
description: Close the gap between NERC CIP compliance and real-world security. Learn hands-on skills to protect the Bulk Electric System and ensure you're always ready for both the next audit and the next threat.

title: FOR710: Reverse-Engineering Malware: Advanced Code Analysis
description: FOR710: Reverse-Engineering Malware: Advanced Code Analysis prepares malware specialists to dissect sophisticated Windows executables, such as those that dominate the headlines and preoccupy incident response teams across the globe. This malware reverse engineering course not only includes essential background and instructor-led walkthroughs, but also provides students with numerous opportunities to tackle real-world reverse engineering scenarios during class.

title: SEC580: Metasploit for Enterprise Penetration Testing
description: SEC580 empowers penetration testers and security professionals to harness the full capabilities of the Metasploit Framework for professional, enterprise-level assessments. Students will explore advanced exploitation, post-exploitation, and pivoting techniques, leveraging the power of Meterpreter, client-side attacks, and integration with tools like Empire, Cobalt Strike, and Living Off The Land binaries. In this Metasploit pentesting course, emphasis is placed on stealth, automation, antivirus evasion, and simulating real-world adversaries in enterprise environments. Through hands-on labs and realistic attack scenarios, this course helps participants extend beyond traditional usage of Metasploit and apply it in structured, effective, and compliant penetration testing methodologies.

title: SEC760: Advanced Exploit Development for Penetration Testers
description: Develop advanced exploit development skills to discover vulnerabilities, analyze patches, and write complex exploits while working with modern security controls.

title: ICS418: ICS Security Essentials for Leaders
description: The ICS418: ICS Security Essentials for Leaders course is designed to equip leaders responsible for critical infrastructure and operational technology (OT) environments with the tools and strategies needed to manage industrial cyber risks effectively. This two-day course addresses the unique challenges of securing ICS/OT systems, prioritizing safety, reliability, and business objectives while adapting to evolving threats and technologies. Participants will gain the skills to lead teams, processes, and technologies in developing and sustaining robust ICS security programs.

title: SEC366: CIS Implementation Group 1
description: SEC366 is the starting point for implementing cybersecurity no matter how small your organization or team is. Small to medium size businesses and non-profits are not immune to threats, but may not have the budgets to create and maintain cybersecurity teams to defend against the ever-growing threat landscape. Most of these organizations have an employee who has been tasked with managing security, often with no background in security and no training. Every organization needs professionals who can maintain foundational cybersecurity with training in CIS Implementation Group 1.

title: FOR528: Ransomware and Cyber Extortion
description: Analyze real-world attacks and gain the hands-on training you need to respond to ransomware or cyber extortion incidents.

title: ICS613: ICS/OT Penetration Testing & Assessments
description: Security professionals gain critical skills to conduct safe, effective penetration tests and assessments in ICS/OT environments without compromising operational integrity.

title: SEC673: Advanced Information Security Automation with Python
description: Dive into advanced Python coding techniques from top open-source security tools and empower yourself to build secure, scalable solutions across a wide range of high-demand fields.

title: SEC467: Social Engineering for Security Professionals
description: Plan, execute, and defend against social engineering attacks by mastering the psychology, tools, and techniques used by adversaries and professional testers.

title: FOR608: Enterprise-Class Incident Response & Threat Hunting
description: Learn to identify and respond to enterprise-class incidents. Deepen your threat hunting abilities using enterprise-class tools and digging into analysis methodologies to understand attacker movement.

title: FOR500: Windows Forensic Analysis
description: Gain an essential understanding of Windows artifacts and learn to perform digital forensics in Microsoft Windows operating systems to recover, analyze, and authenticate data and solve a forensic case.

title: SEC401J: Security Essentials - Network, Endpoint, and Cloud (Japanese)
description: Gain essential cybersecurity skills to quickly detect, respond to, and remediate threats. Learn how to protect critical information and technology assets, whether on-premises or in the cloud.

title: SEC587: Advanced Open-Source Intelligence (OSINT) Gathering and Analysis
description: Learn how to perform advanced OSINT investigations as well as utilize JSON and Python. Explore topics such as cryptocurrency, the dark web, disinformation, and advanced image and video OSINT analysis.

title: SEC566: Implementing and Auditing CIS Controls
description: Transform the CIS Controls into a defensible roadmap that strengthens security, ensures compliance, and prepares your organization for the future.

title: SEC510: Cloud Security Engineering and Controls
description: Prevent cloud incidents from becoming breaches with attack-driven controls. Explore real-world case studies, build multicloud defenses, and secure emerging GenAI workloads through hands-on labs.

title: SEC504: Hacker Tools, Techniques, and Incident Handling
description: Master real-world incident response through hands-on labs, AI-powered analysis, and attacker mindset training. AI doesn't change the need for expertise—it raises the bar for what expertise looks like.

title: SEC450: SOC Analyst Training – Applied Skills for Cyber Defense Operations
description: This course delivers essential training for Security Operations Center (SOC) analysts, equipping you with the skills to detect, stop cyberattacks, and safeguard your organization’s data and systems.

title: SEC598: AI and Security Automation for Red, Blue, and Purple Teams
description: Harness GenAI, agentic AI, world-class automation, emulation and detection-as-code to unify red and blue operations into a continuous purple team model.

title: SEC595: Applied Data Science and AI/Machine Learning for Cybersecurity Professionals
description: Acquire practical data science and machine learning skills to build custom AI-driven security solutions that transform your organization's threat detection capabilities.

title: SEC545: (5-Day) GenAI and LLM Application Security
description: Secure every layer of your GenAI stack in SEC545 5-Day. Gain hands-on experience with LLMs, agents, MLOps, and cloud deployments, including threat modeling, manual model training, and a CTF on real-world AI infrastructure.

title: SEC545S: (3 Day) GenAI and LLM Application Security
description: Secure the full GenAI lifecycle, mastering hands-on strategies to defend LLMs, agents, and RAG-powered apps from development to deployment.

title: SEC535: Offensive AI - Attack Tools and Techniques
description: Leverage cutting-edge AI tools and techniques to enhance offensive operations, automate attacks, and advance your penetration testing capabilities.

title: SEC495: Leveraging LLMs: Building & Securing RAG, Contextual RAG, and Agentic RAG
description: Learn to build secure, self-hosted LLM solutions using Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) for tasks like knowledge retrieval and policy creation, while implementing defenses against prompt injection and enforcing information sensitivity controls—all without relying on public APIs or third-party platforms.

title: SEC411: AI Security Principles and Practices: GenAI and LLM Defense
description: SEC411 is a living, practitioner-focused AI security course for cybersecurity professionals entering GenAI and LLM defense. No prior AI experience required.

title: FOR563: Applied AI for Digital Forensics and Incident Response: Leveraging Local Large Language Models
description: FOR563 teaches DFIR professionals to harness private, local AI using Large Language Models (LLMs) for secure, hands-on investigation and analysis at scale.

title: SEC301: Introduction to Cyber Security
description: SEC301 introduces cybersecurity fundamentals for non-technical professionals, empowering them to understand risks, terminology, and best practices to support security in any role.

title: LDR520: Emerging Trends for Cyber Leaders: AI and Cloud
description: Lead AI and cloud security transformation with clarity. Master strategic frameworks to drive business innovation and build defenses against tomorrow's threats.

title: FOR585: Smartphone Forensic Analysis In-Depth
description: Your forensic tools report data—but they cannot determine if the user created it. Learn to validate mobile artifacts, recover evidence tools miss, and testify with confidence in court.

title: LDR433: Managing Human Risk
description: This intensive three-day course prepares you to build a mature awareness program, providing you with the roadmap, skills, and lessons learned on how to effectively manage and measure your organization’s human risk.

title: SEC665: Advanced Red Team Operations
description: An intense advanced red team course focusing on advanced tradecraft: stealthy initial access, privesc, cloud/on-prem tradecraft, EDR internals and research.

title: SEC503: Network Monitoring and Threat Detection In-Depth
description: Gain technical knowledge in network monitoring and threat detection. Learn to identify emerging threats, perform large-scale correlation for threat hunting, and reconstruct network attacks.

title: SEC542: Web App Penetration Testing and Ethical Hacking
description: Build real-world web app offensive skills with a hands-on, repeatable process for finding, exploiting, and clearly proving the vulnerabilities that matter.

title: SEC275: Foundations: Computers, Technology, & Security
description: SANS Foundations is the perfect starting point for anyone new to cybersecurity or looking to build a solid technical base. Designed with beginners in mind, this cybersecurity foundations course covers essential concepts like operating systems, networking, security principles, and hands-on skills with tools used by professionals in the field. Whether you're exploring a new career, supporting security teams, or preparing for advanced training, SEC275 provides the critical knowledge needed to understand and engage with cybersecurity. With engaging content, practical labs, and expert instruction, you’ll gain the confidence and capability to take your next step in the cyber world. No prior experience required just curiosity and a drive to learn.Preview the course for free.
